office:text.text:p: Long Short Term Memory in MLP Pair
Institute of Information and Communication Technologies - Bulgarian Academy of Sciences
akad. Georgi Bonchev Str., block. 2, office 514, 1113 Sofia, Bulgaria

text:p.text:span: This study focuses on the capabilities to introduce long short-term memory in classical multilayer perceptron. In MLP there are not recurrent links and because of that it has no memory capabilities. The idea of the solution proposed is to improve MLP time series forecasting possibilities by introduction of modified long short-term memory model as pair of artificial neural networks.
artificial neural networks, time series forecasting, backpropagation, machine learning

text:section.text:p: Artificial neural networks (ANNs) as math models with the goal to describe natural neural systems was introduced in the middle of 20th century. In their organization ANNs are oriented weighted graph. ANNs are basically used in two modes - training and usage. The training mode is determined by the search for such weights values [7,9,10] that the ANN learns the information from the input to output information as well as possible. In the most used case of ANNs the MLP the signals are transmitted from the input to the output. The input information in each neuron is coming from the outputs of the previous neurons. The external impact obtained by this way is then processed in a summation function. The most used summation function is the linear function (neurons' output signals are multiplied by the weights of the connections). This is the general case but functions different than the linear function also can be applied. The output of the summation function is then transferred to a function for normalization which determines the activation level of the neuron. In the literature a set of activation functions are proposed. Some of them are well established when others not so well [11].

text:p.text:span: In the classical MLP links between the neurons are only from the input to the output. It is not possible for the signals to travel from the output to the input. Backward only the neurons' error is propagated in the backward pass. In ANN with such topology it is not possible some past information to remain circulating in the network. Because of this MLPs are not so suitable for forecasting tasks and generally in the field of the financial time series forecasting. The lack of memory in MLP is overcome by the introduction of recurrent links as it was done in Jordan and Elman networks.
If we put two MLPs in pair we can achieve network memory
As input of MLP1 past values of the time series are provided with combination of MPL2 output.
At the output of MLP1 the forecast is expected.
MLP1 output is also used as input for MLP2.
After that signals are propagated in MLP2.
By this way MLP2 is used as network memory.
In this implementation both MLPs are trained with backpropagation of the error.
The values of the time series are normalized before to be supplied in MLP1.
itself is conditionally divided on past frame (lag) and future frame (lead).
It is possible to use other function instead of the most used activation functions
In this research to different activation functions are proposed (Fig. 2-5).
The fading sin function is presented on Fig. 2 and its formula with Eq. 1.
Fading sin derivative is presented with Eq. 2 and it is visualized in Fig. 3. A small disadvantaged in its derivative is that it has two break points.
With less periodic influence is the second proposal of exponent regulated sin in Fig. 4 with formula Eq. 3
The derivative of exponent regulated sine is presented in Fig. 4.

text:section.text:p: It can be provided as formula by usage of the function itself as it is shown in Eq. 5.

text:p.text:span: Disadvantage in this derivative is that it has breakpoint when x is zero.
In both derivatives there is periodic component Fig. 3 and Fig. 5. Periodic functions are problematic in gradient descent methods such as backpropagation of the error.

An efficient way to escape from these complications is artificially to replace the derivatives with much smoother and much more effective function as proposed in Fig. 6. Such artificial replacement of derivatives is possible because of the way in which Encog ANN programming library is designed.

The usage of fading function gives to the neurons a behavior of input signals saturation. If the input signals are too strong the neurons will stop working. By such barrier the responsibilities of the neurons in the hidden layers are much better divided.
All the experiments performed and the results achieved are done with the Encog program library

text:section.text:p: All experiments runs are conducted on a desktop computer with the MacOS Sierra 10.12.2 operating system, the 2.3 GHz Intel Core i5 processor and 8 GB of RAM, and the Encog Core v3.3.0 Java Version, Java 8 Update 112 (64bit).

The same experiment was performed with two different networks [6], the first having no recurrent links (topology 15-11-5), and the second network was a combination of two multilayer perceptron (MLP1 with topology 20-11-5 and MLP2 with topology 5-6-5). As a time series, publicly available data on the number of earthquakes per year with magnitude of 7.0 or greater for the period from 1900 to 1998 year. The paired multilayer perceptron has slightly better predictive properties than the three-layer MLP as it is shown in Fig. 7 and Fig. 8. In terms of training time, the pair performs slightly worse than the single MLP, which is shown in Fig. 9 and Fig. 10.
The proposed model of MLP pair leads to results with improved training time and forecasting accuracy.

MLP pair shows promising results when it is compared with single MLP in the problem of financial time series forecasting. Training of the MLP pair is more time consuming, but it is logical because the network consists of more neurons and much more connections than the single MLP. The proposed alternatives for activation functions are leading to better distribution of the information in the hidden layers.

text:p.text:span: As further development it will be interesting this kind of training to be implemented as parallel or distributed computing as it is proposed in [3,5,8]. Another direction of further development is the application in big data problems as described in [12]. In this study backpropagation of error was used, but evolutionary or population based training heuristics can be applied as proposed in [1,2].
This work was supported by a private funding of Velbazhd Software LLC.
